*f~- CW>x ent
examine ent
At first glance this tall, handsome Ent could be mistaken for a resplendent 
beech tree. However, his downcast posture and the solemn sadness in his deep
penetrating eyes shows there is a soul within this seemingly woody exterior.
His skin is a shining silver in colour and is as smooth as leather. Atop his 
stately head is mounted a flourish of glossy, ovate leaves. Fine hair-like 
lichens cover his long, elegant arms. Each arm eventually splits into four 
slender, twig-like fingers. His straight sturdy legs are flanged at the base 
and he wears a covering of moss, like shoes, on his feet.
Beechbone the Ent is in an excellent condition.
Beechbone the Ent is using:
<held>               a large clay bowl
<worn around neck>   a rough wooden horn

!f' CW HP:Fine Mana:Hot Move:Tired>
At first glance, this animal appears to be exceptionally strong, muscular and
spirited. Further examination reveals that its hoofs are broad and large and
its eyes are bright and alert. This courageous, intelligent and kind animal
runs clean, straight and true - an exceptional mount but for its diminutive
size.

!O CW HP:Fine Mana:Cold Mordrath the Uroth-Ghash:Fine Hap (mo):Fine>
Once a dreaded warrior, this orc has abandoned his battleaxe and armour and
devoted himself to the realm of magical formulae and incantations. He is the
Uroth-Ghash, the lone shaman of the tribe. A wicked glint in his eyes reveals
his truly depraved self. Scars and tattoos decorate the visible portions of his
body, forming strange shapes. Most prominent is a symbol that is repeatedly
visible: a spiked club, dripping with blood.
Mordrath the Uroth-Ghash has several bruises.
Mordrath the Uroth-Ghash seems to have:
       A clean light wound at the left arm.
Mordrath the Uroth-Ghash is using:

<worn on body>       a plain shirt (flawless)
<worn about body>    a mottled cloak (flawless); it glows blue

<worn on legs>       a plain pair of pants (satisfactory)
<worn on feet>       a black pair of padded boots (well-maintained)
<worn as belt>       a plain leather belt
<worn on belt>       a belt pouch

examine Amanrandil
You look upon a solemn Noldo Elf from another age. Burdened with the weight
of Eregion's spirits, Amanrandil tirelessly leads the Daedeltiri to ease their
suffering. The Daedeltiri have sworn to watch the shadows of the ancient 
elven dead and to protect them and others from the horrors of the past. Once
regal and proud like the rest of his  people, he now walks with a saintly aura
of humility and sorrow. But deep within the eyes of this peaceful elf you 
sense the tension of an undying rage forever held against the evil of all 
Sauron's works.
Amanrandil is in an excellent condition.

examine brolg
Short and ugly, Brolg is still one of the most feared and powerful orcs of the 
Ohurk tribes. Several scars across his black skin testify to the numerous and 
fierce battles he has fought. Chanting evil words of power, his realm is not 
the one of the sword, but that of dark magic. Even so, he is a skilled fighter 
and rules his tribe with an iron hand.
Brolg the orkish shaman looks pretty hurt.

       A clean light wound at the right leg.

<wielded>            a dark broadsword (well-maintained)
<held>               an orkish battle-standard (flawless)
<worn about body>    a mottled cloak (satisfactory)
<worn on finger>     a ring
<worn as belt>       a plain leather belt
<worn on belt>       a belt pouch
<worn on belt>       a weapon sheath

!O CW HP:Fine Mana:Burning>help mume
ABOUT, MUME


What is MUME?
-------------
MUME, Multi-Users in Middle-earth, is a multiplayer role-playing game based
upon J.R.R. Tolkien's creations.

The action takes place in the late Third Age, before The Hobbit and after the
loss of the One Ring by Sauron. The key to Erebor has just found by Gandalf in
Dol Guldur and all the epic tales narrated in The Lord of the Rings may take
place.

MUME is written in C and in mudlle (a functional language that was developed in
order to allow online extensions to the game) and has been running since
January 1992.

MUME is running on a FIRE machine. You can either play by connecting directly
by telnet to mume.org port 4242 or connecting via the web client on our
website.

If you are new to MUME or MUDs in general, you should consult our newbie page,
help newcomer. It contains introductory texts for complete beginners, as well
as information on MUME's unique features for those who have already played
other MUDs.

To see how MUME (d)evolved over the years, try help mume <version>, where
<version> is a Roman numeral (I, II, III, IV, etc.).

See also: NEWBIE, SUBJECTS, ADVANCED, CLIENT, MUDLLE
